title: SQL Connections: Don't ask for custom password after every change is done.
author: cguadall
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior

Only ask for custom encryption password for connections at startup time.

## Current Behavior

When using SQL Server connections (tested on MySQL), after every change password is asked in a new popup window. This is quite annoying.

But what is more annoying is that if from another session someone doesn't enter the custom password (pop-up password window loose the focus) and make any change, previous change are lost.

comments.author: ductnone
comments.snippet:
Thank you for this great piece of software. 

Is there a fix for this issue yet? This issue requires a big workaround on the user side and makes it hard to keep the SQL database updated when using the SQL feature on a big scale. When everyone starts editing shortcuts, prompts appear so often that the software becomes unusable.
I am looking forward to a fix.

Using: 1.77.3 Nightly Build: 1784

notes:
AI triage (claude): SQL connections repeatedly prompt for a custom password after any settings change, instead of caching credentials for the session.
Approach: Cache the SQL custom password in memory (SecureString) for the session lifetime and only re-prompt when credentials are explicitly cleared or authentication fails, rather than prompting on every settings change.
